intro: Koeleria australiensis var. maxima, commonly known as the Australian Koeleria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, blue to purple flowers. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Koeleria australiensis var. maxima is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and provide habitat for native fauna.
